DOC.brief_summary: The aim study determine effect innovative child-friendly remind-to-move treatment ( RTM ) treatment compare constraint-induced movement therapy ( CIMT ) upper extremity outcomes child hemiplegic Cerebral Palsy . In evaluator-blinded randomized control trial , 73 child , among 20 Manual Ability Classification System level I , 38 level II , 15 level III , recruit 3 special school randomize receive 75-hour RTM ( n=25 ) CIMT ( n=24 ) programme 15-weekdays , conventional treatment ( n=24 ) . The primary outcome Jebsen-Taylor Hand Function Test ( JTHFT ) Bruininks-Oseretsky Test Motor Proficiency ( BOTMP-II ) Subtest 3 assess motor efficiency baseline , posttest , 1- 3-month follow-up .
DOC.brief_title: `` Remind Move '' Treatment Versus Constraint-induced Movement Therapy Children With Hemiplegic Cerebral Palsy
DOC.criteria: Diagnosis Hemiplegic Cerebral Palsy Aged 5 16 year Ability follow instruction Ability grasp release light object , least 20° wrist 10°fingers metacarpophalangeal joint extension full flexion affect hand Manual Activity Classification System ( MACS ) 19 grade I , II III affect hand Severe cognitive , visual , auditory disorder Seizure health problem associate cerebral palsy Predominant spasticity contracture grade 3 Modified Ashworth Scale 20 wrist finger flexor , forearm pronator ⁄ thumb adductor Receiving new pharmaceutical ( i.e . botulinum toxin injection ) and/or surgical intervention within 6month study
